results.title: Psychics, saints and scientists
results.creator_credit: Irving Hartley, Hartley Productions and Harvey F. Bellin
results.brief_description: Parapsychologist Thelma Moss introduces the field of psychic phenomena and acts as mistress of ceremonies for a discussion by scientists who are responsible for particular areas of study, such as healing, bio-feedback training, psychokinesis, telepathy, and extrasensory perception. Explains that only recently has parapsychology gained respect as a field of serious scientific consideration.

results.title: Pruning practices at the Brooklyn Botanic Gardens
results.creator_credit: Centre for Mass Communication and Stuart Chasmar
results.brief_description: Shows how proper pruning produces healthy plants of good appearance. Demonstrates techniques of pruning deciduous and evergreen trees, roses, rhododendron, forsythia, lilac, hedges etc., and follows the growth of the plants through the year.

results.title: Providence
results.creator_credit: Klaus Hellwig, Yves Peyrot, Yves Gasser and Alain Resnais
results.brief_description:
This is a perversely hilarious comedy about one restless night (among many) in the fading life of ageing, over-sexed novelist, Clive Langham. Clive lives alone in a country mansion and spends his nights cursing his fate as he inserts suppositories, sits on the ‘throne’ and downs bottle after bottle of white wine. In his nightmare, the characters of his novel mix with his real life relatives. As Clive gathers his relatives around him for a final week-end and they attempt to nurse him back to life, he realises that they are not the monsters he perceived them to be.

Credits: Produces, Yves Gasser, Yves Renot, Klaus Hellwig ; director, Alain Resnais ; writers, David Mercer ; photography, Ricardo Aronovitch ; music, Miklos Rozsa ; art direction, Jacques Saulnier.
Cast: Dirk Bogarde, Ellen Burstyn, John Gielgud, David Warner, Elain Stritch, Peter Arne.

results.title: Proud years
results.creator_credit: Potomac Films and George C. Stoney

results.title: Proud ships: A glimpse of the Shell tanker at work
results.creator_credit: Shell Film Unit and Philip Armitage
results.brief_description: One-fifth of the merchant ships afloat consists of tankers which form a floating chain between the oilfields of the world and the consumer. The film centres round a single tanker - the “Liparus” - on her normal run, introducing her officers and some of her crew. The modern takner is a large and handsome vessel and special care is devoted to ensuring good living conditions for officers and men. Because of possible danger there is a fixed routine of weekly boat drill, and fire-drills are taken seriously. As a result tankers are “the best bet there is on the insurance market”.
